problem: Given the equation $\frac{z-2}{z+2} = -i$, solve for the complex number $z$.
solution: From the equation: $\frac{z-2}{z+2} = -i \Rightarrow z-2 = -i(z+2) \Rightarrow z-2 = -iz - 2i \Rightarrow z + iz = 2 - 2i \Rightarrow z(1+i) = 2 - 2i. $ Then we get $z = \frac{2 - 2i}{1 + i} = \frac{(2 - 2i)(1 - i)}{(1 + i)(1 - i)} = \frac{2 - 2i - 2i - 2}{2} = \boxed{-2i}$.
